{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.00523v1", "title": "A complement of the Erdős-Hajnal problem on paths with equal-degree
  endpoints", "summary": "Answering a question of Erd\H{o}s and Hajnal, Chen and Ma proved that for all
$n\geq600$ every graph with $2n + 1$ vertices and at least $n^2 + n+1$ edges
contains two vertices of equal degree connected by a path of length three, and
the complete bipartite graph $K_{n,n+1}$ shows that this edge bound is sharp.
In this paper, we obtain the above result for all $n\ge2$, and thus resolve the
question of Erd\H{o}s and Hajnal completely.", "main_category": "math.CO", "categories": "math.CO", "published": "2025-05-01T13:44:43Z"}
